laboratory_examinations.findings: Initially low serum PBI at 3 months (3.8 g/100ml, Normal range 5.3â€“7.3), raised PBI at age 3.2 years (14.8 g/100ml)
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Raised PBI at age 3.2 years prompted thyroxine discontinuation; PBI levels returned normal with treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal FT4 and FT3 levels off thyroxine treatment, subnormal FT4/FT3 ratio, low rT3 levels.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: After thyroxine therapy, elevated FT3 and high-normal FT4, TSH levels suppressed.

laboratory_examinations.findings: At baseline, parameters in hypothyroid range.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Most parameters remained within hypothyroid or control ranges after thyroxine therapy.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Raised CK-MM isoenzyme levels, elevated before treatment.

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Rising markers post thyroxine treatment, some high-normal, others becoming elevated.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Reduction in red cell mass with raised mean corpuscular volume (MCV); normal WBC and slightly reduced platelet counts.
